llama2_direct_sole-planning_results:
Of course! Based on the information provided, I have devised a 7-day travel itinerary for you and your companion starting in Salt Lake City and visiting three unique cities in Montana from March 16th to 22nd, 2022. Please find the itinerary below:

Day 1 (March 16th): Salt Lake City to Billings

* Fly from Salt Lake City to Billings (flight duration: 1 hour 5 minutes, flight number: F3536653 or F3806189)
* Check into your preferred accommodation in Billings (e.g., Best Western Plus Billings Hotel & Suites or Rodeway Inn Billings)
* Explore the city's historic district, visit the Yellowstone Art Museum, and enjoy dinner at one of the city's many restaurants (e.g., The Montana Cafe, Bistro 45, or The Iron Horse Hotel)

Day 2 (March 17th): Billings

* Start your day with breakfast at a local café (e.g., The Coffee Cup or Java Junction)
* Visit the Billings Museum of Art and History to learn about the city's rich history and culture
* Take a stroll along the Yellowstone River and enjoy the scenic views
* For lunch, head to one of the city's many eateries (e.g., The Downtowner or El Patio)
* In the evening, catch a show at the Alberta Bair Theater or enjoy dinner at a local restaurant (e.g., La Taqueria or The Onyx Cafe)

Day 3 (March 18th): Billings to Bozeman

* Drive from Billings to Bozeman (approximate distance: 299 km, travel time: 4 hours)
* Check into your preferred accommodation in Bozeman (e.g., The Lodge at Bridger Creek or Homewood Suites by Hilton Bozeman)
* Spend the rest of the day exploring Bozeman's many outdoor attractions, such as the Gallatin River, the Bridger Mountains, or the Bozeman Hot Springs
* For dinner, head to one of the city's many restaurants (e.g., The Ould Sod or The Chestnut)

Day 4 (March 19th): Bozeman

* Start your day with breakfast at a local café (e.g., The Daily Bread or Java Junction)
* Visit the Museum of the Rockies to learn about the region's geology, paleontology, and indigenous cultures
* Take a stroll through Bozeman's vibrant downtown area and shop at one of the many local boutiques (e.g., The Montana Store or The Bozeman Boutique)
* For lunch, head to one of the city's many eateries (e.g., The Pickle Barrel or The Blue Goose)
* In the evening, enjoy dinner at a local restaurant (e.g., The Copper Whisker or The Sweet Pea Bistro)

Day 5 (March 20th): Bozeman to Great Falls

* Drive from Bozeman to Great Falls (approximate distance: 299 km, travel time: 4 hours)
* Check into your preferred accommodation in Great Falls (e.g., The Heritage Inn or The River's Edge Resort)
* Spend the rest of the day exploring Great Falls' many outdoor attractions, such as the Missouri River, the Electric City Water Park, or the Great Falls Historic Walking Tour
* For dinner, head to one of the city's many restaurants (e.g., The River's Edge Restaurant or The Falls Cafe)

Day 6 (March 21st): Great Falls

* Start your day with breakfast at a local café (e.g., The Daily Grind or Java Junction)
* Visit the Malcolm Rocks State Park to explore the area's unique geological features
* Take a stroll through Great Falls' historic downtown area and shop at one of the many local boutiques (e.g., The Great Falls Emporium or The River's Edge Gift Shop)
* For lunch, head to one of the city's many eateries (e.g., The River's Edge Restaurant or The Falls Cafe)
* In the evening, enjoy dinner at a local restaurant (e.g., The Great Falls Brewing Company or The Falls Tavern)

Day 7 (March 22nd): Great Falls to Salt Lake City

* Drive from Great Falls to Salt Lake City (approximate distance: 660 km, travel time: 8 hours)
* Check into your preferred accommodation in Salt Lake City (e.g., The Grand America Hotel or The Little America Inn)
* Spend the rest of the day exploring Salt Lake City's many attractions, such as Temple Square, the Natural History Museum of Utah, or the Utah State Capitol Building
* For dinner, head to one of the city's many restaurants (e.g., The Roof Restaurant or The Bistro at the Little America Inn)

Budget Breakdown:

* Flights from Salt Lake City to Billings and Bozeman: $600 - $800 per person (approximate cost based on current flight prices)
* Accommodations for 7 nights in Salt Lake City, Billings, and Bozeman: $1,500 - $2,000 per person (based on current hotel prices)
* Food and activities in each city: $1,000 - $1,500 per person (based on current restaurant and attraction prices)

Total estimated cost for the 7-day trip: $3,100 - $4,300 per person.

Note: Prices are subject to change based on current market conditions and may vary depending on the time of year and other factors. It's always a good idea to research and compare prices to ensure you get the best deals.
